Class of 2020 Graduation news!
BJSHS will be moving forward with its planned July 12th Graduation ceremony. There will be two sessions and students will be assigned to the sessions according to alphabetical order. Administration believes the two-session approach will help with social distancing and provide an opportunity to clean between the two ceremonies.
Session one will start at 1 p.m. and will include all students that have last names A through L. The second session will start at 3 p.m. and include students M through Z. While face masks are not required to be utilized, they are highly recommended.
The gym will open 30 mins prior to the ceremony and tickets will be required for entry. The ten tickets that are available for each student to distribute will be handed out during the practice sessions which will be held on Friday, July 10th. The 10 a.m. practice session will be for last names A-L and students M-Z will practice at 11 a.m.
Please contact the BJSHS administrators if you have any questions or concerns.
#Classof2020 #BruinPride

BCS Parents, please help us continue planning for the upcoming school year. 👇👇👇

May 27, 2020

Dear Parents and Staff,

The Indiana Department of Education (IDOE) has partnered with Panorama Education to provide school districts in Indiana the opportunity to collect valuable data as we plan for the 2020-2021 school year. Two of those opportunities are (1) Parent/Caregiver Needs Survey and (2) Staff Distance Learning and Well-Being Survey. These surveys are voluntary, anonymous, and only provide district level data. The surveys do not provide building level data, but will provide data based on grade levels. Your honest responses to these surveys will help Blackford Community Schools plan and prepare for the 2020-2021 school year.

You can access the surveys at the following link: http://bit.ly/idoeremotelearning

Again, these surveys are anonymous and voluntary, and we would greatly appreciate your participation.

Sincerely,

James M. Trinkle II, Ph.D.
Coordinator of Special Services
School Psychologist, #1591120
Blackford County Schools

Montpelier Elementary School
March 31 at 1:06 PM ·

Rose-Hulman’s AskRose Homework Help has added daytime hours to help homebound students better understand math and science homework problems from their virtual or online classes during the current coronavirus public health crisis that has led to many schools moving to an e-learning environment.

Free homework help is now available Monday through Friday from noon to 3 p.m. (Eastern Standard Time) by a phone call, email or chat session. Our traditional hours remain unchanged: Sunday through Thursday from 7-10 p.m. (Eastern Standard Time.)

Students may call 877-ASK-ROSE (877-275-7673) or email and chat on our AskRose website, AskRose.org. The site also offers more than 500 resources available through videos and downloadable reference materials.

Rose-Hulman students also are doing remote learning but are able to continue offering this service from locations throughout the country.

I can't guarantee all your questions will be answered immediately, (honestly, we just may not know the answer right now), so we ask that you please be patient. Hopefully, you will soon find the answer on the BCS FAQ Page.
Please email your questions to: bjones@blackfordschools.org.
Once again, we thank our BCS family for your patience and understanding as we continue to work through these unprecedented times.
